page.title: 20World War 2 - Willoughby
page.content: One of the few evident remains of the Second World War is in the paddock to the north of Willoughby parish church in the form of a concrete pill-box. Its position controls one of the roads that run inland to Willoughby from the coast. It was built as an anti- invasion measure early in the war. { CREDITS} The Block was surveyed by staff and pupils of Queen Elizabeth's Grammar School, Alford. The staff involved were B.A.T.Benson,J.Hedley,G.Walker and G.D.Newstead. The pupils involved were Julie Barton,Sue Hill,Sarah East, Lorna Scott,Sue Williams, Vicky Amery, Jane Boyes,Sarah Pridgeon,Samantha Earley,Tanya Gillingham,Lee Harrison, Stephen Bateman, Harry Philpot, Rachel Carlin,Mandy Lee and Sophie Manning. Local people provided information in interviews and Stuart Reder the poetry
